post.title: Go - Create GitHub Releases with GoReleaser
post.description: Easily create GitHub Releases with GoReleaser
post.content:
So you just finished your neat little go project and want to distribute it via Github Releases{:target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer"}. Fear not! GoReleaser{:target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer"} is an amazing tool to get you started with only a few steps.

Requirements:

  • Go
  • Github Repository
  • Github Token

Steps

  1. First of all install the latest version of GoReleaser (for example via go get)

    go get github.com/goreleaser/goreleaser

  2. Create your configuration file (.goreleaser.yml). A basic one looks something like this:

    # .goreleaser.yml
builds:
  - binary: awesome-project
    goos:
      - windows
      - darwin
      - linux
    goarch:
      - amd64

  3. Make sure to create a Github Token and add it as an environment variable as GITHUB_TOKEN. Find out how to create your Github Token{:target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer"}

    export GITHUB_TOKEN=4a68...

  4. Make sure to push at least one tag (GoReleaser uses the latest tag of your repository)

    git tag -a v0.0.1 -m "Release Test"
git push origin v0.0.1

  5. Run GoReleaser

    goreleaser

  6. Profit!

You now have your first release for your github repository complete with downloadable versions for multiple plattforms and a Changelog with all your commits since the previous tag.

Conclusion

GoReleaser is an amazing tool which works exceptionally well and was really painless to setup.
